<Summary source="https://www.barchart.com/story/news/36991939/what-to-expect-from-alphabets-q4-2025-earnings-report">
## Summary of "What to Expect From Alphabet's Q4 2025 Earnings Report"

**Source:** Barchart.com  
**Date:** January 12, 2026  
**Author:** Aanchal Sugandh

### Key Facts and Statistics:

**Upcoming Earnings:**
- Alphabet will report Q4 2025 results on **Wednesday, Feb. 4** (after market close)
- Analysts project Q4 2025 diluted EPS of **$2.59**, up 20.5% from $2.15 a year ago
- Full-year fiscal 2025 EPS expected at **$10.58**, marking a 31.6% year-over-year increase
- Fiscal 2026 projected EPS of **$11.04**, up 4.4% year over year
- The company has surpassed EPS expectations in each of the past four quarters

**Stock Performance:**
- Shares have surged **69.4%** over the past 52 weeks
- Gained nearly **5%** year-to-date
- This outpaces the S&P 500 Index, which rose 17.7% (52-week) and 1.8% (YTD)
- State Street Communication Services Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLC) climbed 21.2% over the past year

**Q3 2025 Results (reported Oct. 29, 2025):**
- Revenue exceeded $100 billion for the first time: **$102.35 billion** (up 15.9% year over year)
- Beat analyst estimate of $99.89 billion
- EPS climbed 35.4% to **$2.87**, exceeding expectations by $0.58
- Advertising contributed **$74.2 billion**
  - Google Search delivered **$56.6 billion** (up 14.5% year over year)
  - YouTube added **$10.3 billion**
- Google Cloud posted **$15.2 billion** in revenue (up 33.5% year over year)
- Shares rose approximately 2.7% on announcement day and another 2.5% the following session

**Analyst Ratings:**
- **"Strong Buy"** consensus rating (held for past three months)
- Of 55 analysts: 45 rate "Strong Buy," 4 recommend "Moderate Buy," 6 call for "Hold"
- Mean price target: **$334.23** (1.7% potential upside)
- Street-high target: **$400** (21.7% potential gain from current levels)

**Company Overview:**
- Valued at roughly **$4 trillion**
- Core businesses: global search, online advertising, cloud computing, AI, hardware, and emerging healthcare
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://global.morningstar.com/en-eu/stocks/going-into-earnings-is-alphabet-stock-buy-sell-or-fairly-valued-3">
# Summary of Morningstar Article on Alphabet's Q4 2025 Earnings Preview

**Publication Date:** January 28, 2026  
**Earnings Release Date:** February 4, 2026 (after market close)

## Key Valuation Metrics
- **Fair Value Estimate:** $340.00 per share
- **Morningstar Rating:** 3 stars (fairly valued)
- **Economic Moat Rating:** Wide
- **Uncertainty Rating:** Medium

## Revenue Growth Forecast
- Morningstar forecasts Alphabet's revenue growing at a **13% compound annual growth rate over the next five years**
- The fair value estimate implies a 2025 adjusted P/E multiple of 32x and EV/adjusted EBITDA multiple of 25x

## Key Metrics to Watch in Q4 Earnings
1. **Google Cloud growth** - identified as "the most important metric" to demonstrate Gen AI monetization
2. **Capital expenditure guidance for 2026** - expecting an increase
3. **Search advertising performance** - Q4 is typically strong for advertising, expecting solid search sales
4. **AI-related commentary** - potential competition with OpenAI, ads in AI mode, and general Gen AI search monetization

## Financial Position
- Closed 2024 with **$96 billion in cash and cash equivalents**
- Debt balance of **$11 billion**
- Financial position described as "virtually unassailable"
- Advertising business generates "tens of billions of dollars in free cash flow annually"

## Risk Factors Noted
- Antitrust regulation uncertainty
- Potential AI-infused search market competition
- High concentration risk from text-based advertising remaining largest revenue contributor
- Data privacy and security concerns

**Note:** This article does not provide specific regional revenue forecasts for EMEA or other geographic segments.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://global.morningstar.com/en-eu/stocks/ai-stocks-winners-laggards-losers-2025">
# Summary of Article: "AI Stocks: Winners, Laggards, and Losers of 2025"

**Source:** Morningstar, Inc. | **Date:** January 14, 2026

## Key Facts and Statistics:

### Overall AI Stock Performance in 2025:
- Morningstar's AI basket (34 stocks) rose **50.8%** in 2025
- US Market Index gained **17.3%** 
- Tech sector rose **21.4%**
- 21 out of 34 stocks (62%) in the AI basket outperformed the market
- 5 stocks returned more than 100%

### Alphabet-Specific Information:
- **Alphabet (GOOG)** was mentioned as one of the outperformers in 2025
- Alphabet was the **only exception** from outside the tech sector among outperformers (classified under communication services)
- Alphabet is identified as one of the "hyperscalers" committing billions to AI buildout
- Google launched **Gemini 3**, which "posed a big threat to Open AI" according to Morningstar equity analyst Luke Yang
- Alphabet is listed among Marvell Technology's key customers (alongside Amazon and Microsoft)

### Q4 2025 Performance:
- AI stocks outperformed the broader market despite fourth-quarter volatility
- SK Hynix and Micron Technology led the AI basket in Q4, each rising over 70%
- Oracle was the biggest loser, down 30.5% in Q4

### Valuation Context:
- After Q4 volatility, AI stocks traded at a **4% premium** to average fair value estimate (down from 18% premium mid-quarter)
- Early in the year, AI stocks fell to a **29% discount** (lowest on April 8) following trade uncertainty from President Trump's tariffs
- By end of Q3, the group had rebounded to a **13% average premium**

## Notable Expert Opinions:

**Luke Yang (Morningstar equity analyst):** Commented on Google's Gemini 3 impact on Oracle's customer Open AI, indicating Google's competitive positioning in AI.

**Note:** This article focuses primarily on AI stock performance broadly and does not provide specific revenue figures or forecasts for Alphabet's Q4 2025 regional performance.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://www.statista.com/chart/18819/worldwide-market-share-of-leading-cloud-infrastructure-service-providers/">
# Article Summary: "Infographic: AWS Stays Ahead as Cloud Market Accelerates"

**Source:** Statista Daily Data  
**Date:** November 04, 2025  
**Author:** Felix Richter

## Key Facts and Statistics:

### Cloud Market Share (Q3 2025):
- **AWS (Amazon Web Services):** 29% market share
- **Microsoft Azure:** 20% market share
- **Google Cloud:** 13% market share
- The "Big Three" combined account for more than 60% of the cloud market

### Cloud Market Growth:
- **Q3 2025 global cloud infrastructure service spending:** $107 billion (up 28% or $23 billion compared to Q3 2024)
- **Full year 2025 projection:** Cloud infrastructure service revenues will exceed $400 billion for the first time
- Year-over-year growth has been re-accelerating in recent quarters, driven by the AI boom

### AWS Financial Performance:
- In the first nine months of 2025, AWS accounted for:
  - 18% of Amazon's total sales
  - 60% of Amazon's operating profit
- AWS generates more than $100 billion in annual revenue and $40 billion in operating profit

## Named Source Opinions:

- **Matt Garman (CEO of AWS):** Stated that "AWS's best-in-class infrastructure will serve as a backbone for [Open AI's] AI ambitions"
- **Sam Altman (CEO of Open AI):** Praised the partnership for strengthening Open AI's "broad compute ecosystem"
- **John Dinsdale (Chief Analyst at Synergy Research Group):** Called Q3 market numbers "simply very impressive with a record-breaking sequential increase and yet another jump in growth rates" and noted "this is a good time to be a cloud provider"

## Other Notable Information:
- Amazon announced a $38 billion multi-year partnership with Open AI on Monday, causing Amazon's share price to jump 4%
- The partnership gives Open AI access to hundreds of thousands of Nvidia GPUs on AWS infrastructure
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://markets.financialcontent.com/wral/article/predictstreet-2025-12-12-alphabet-inc-googl-an-in-depth-stock-research-article-12122025">
# Summary of Alphabet Inc. Stock Research Article (December 12, 2025)

## Key Financial Facts and Statistics:

**Market Capitalization:**
- As of December 12, 2025: approximately $3.77 trillion to $3.875 trillion
- Positioned as the world's third most valuable company
- Market cap increased 86.93% over the last year

**Recent Financial Performance:**
- Q3 2025: First-ever $100 billion quarter achieved
- Projected 2025 capital expenditures: $91 billion to $93 billion (primarily for AI infrastructure)

**Q3 2025 Revenue Breakdown by Segment:**
- Google Services: Largest contributor (specific figures not provided in excerpt)
- Google Cloud: Emerging as critical growth engine
- Other Bets: Includes ventures like Waymo and Verily

**Stock Performance:**
- **1-Year (Dec 2024 - Dec 2025):** 73.61% total return; 69.82% YTD gain in 2025
- Closing price on December 11, 2025: $312.37
- All-time high: $323.23 (reached November 25, 2025)
- 52-week high: $328.83
- 52-week low: $140.53

- **5-Year Performance:** 265.04% total return; 22.96% CAGR
- **10-Year Performance:** 23.48% CAGR

## Business Context:
- Company operates through three main segments: Google Services, Google Cloud, and Other Bets
- Advertising revenue from Google Services remains largest contributor
- Google Cloud rapidly growing due to AI infrastructure and solutions demand
- Aggressive AI investment strategy in 2025

## Regulatory Environment:
- Facing recent fines from European Commission
- Ongoing antitrust probes in the U.S.

**Note:** This article does not contain specific information about EMEA regional revenues or forecasts. It focuses on overall company performance, stock metrics, and business segment performance without breaking down geographical revenue contributions.
</Summary>

Query: What will Alphabet's Q4 2025 constant-currency revenues be in these global regions? (EMEA)
Here are the relevant news articles:

**ManpowerGroup Q4 Earnings Call Highlights**
ManpowerGroup (NYSE: MAN) reported fourth-quarter 2025 results showing stabilization and sequential improvement in key metrics, with revenue of $4.7 billion in organic constant currency growth of 2% and system-wide revenue of $5.1 billion. Adjusted EBITDA was $100 million, with a margin of 2.1%, matching the prior year and aligning with guidance. CEO Jonas Prising noted strengthening trends in key markets like the U.S. and France, though he cautioned against declaring a broad-based recovery. Engagement levels remained steady despite cautious client hiring. Manpower revenue grew 5% organically, Experis declined 6% (improving from 7% in Q3), and Talent Solutions declined 4% (improving from 8%). Gross profit margin was 16.3%, slightly below guidance due to lower permanent recruitment in Europe, where perm demand remains historically low. Cost discipline was emphasized, with a 4% constant currency reduction in SG&A and Northern Europe achieving positive operating profit for the first time in five quarters. Regional performance varied: Italy showed 7% days-adjusted growth and strong margins; France improved from -4% to -2% monthly decline; Germany declined 22% days-adjusted but with expected improvement in Q1 2026; the U.S. saw a 1% revenue decline but stronger-than-expected performance in MSP and Manpower; APME grew 6% with Japan up 7%. AI and digitization initiatives, including PowerSuite (used in 90% of operations) and an AI Recruiter Toolkit, drove a 7% increase in placement rates. Executives highlighted client interest in flexible work models and AI-driven workforce transformation. The company reaffirmed a long-term adjusted EBITDA margin target of 4.5% to 5%, with expected year-over-year improvement over the next four years. For Q1 2026, ManpowerGroup guided EPS of $0.45 to $0.55 and constant currency revenue between a 1% decline and 3% growth (midpoint: 1% growth). The full-year global tax rate is estimated at 45%, excluding benefits from the unextended U.S. Workers' Opportunity Tax Credit.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 31, 2026 09:06 AM
Source:[Defense World](https://www.defenseworld.net/2026/01/31/manpowergroup-q4-earnings-call-highlights.html)

**Meta Platforms Could Do the Unthinkable to Google This Year**
Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) reported a 24% revenue increase in Q4 2025 to $59.9 billion, with net income rising 9% to $22.8 billion ($8.88 per share), despite margin pressure from increased spending. The company issued first-quarter 2026 guidance of $53.5 billion to $56.5 billion in revenue, representing a 30% year-over-year increase, including a 4% foreign currency tailwind—its fastest quarterly growth in five years. Meta's advertising revenue, which accounted for $196.2 billion of its $201 billion total 2025 revenue, grew 22% in 2025. CFO Susan Li attributed this growth to AI-driven improvements in ad targeting and generative AI tools for advertisers. Based on Q1 guidance, Meta’s ad revenue could reach $251.1 billion in 2026. Alphabet’s advertising revenue through Q3 2025 was $161.4 billion, and if it grows 12% in Q4, it would total $222 billion for 2025. Projected 12% growth in 2026 would yield $248.7 billion, slightly below Meta’s forecast. However, Alphabet’s total ad revenue—including YouTube and Google Network—exceeds $300 billion, giving it a current advantage. Despite this, Meta has outgrown Alphabet in revenue growth over nearly every quarter of the last decade, except during the post-pandemic period. The article argues that Meta’s social media-based advertising model, enhanced by AI, gives it a strategic edge in the AI era, potentially enabling it to surpass Alphabet’s entire advertising business within a few years. While Alphabet has responded to AI competition with Google Gemini and AI overviews in search, Meta’s proactive use of AI in ad targeting and creation is seen as a growth driver. The article concludes that Meta is well-positioned to become the world’s largest advertising business and a market-beater in 2026 and beyond.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 31, 2026 12:50 AM
Source:[NASDAQ Stock Market](https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/meta-platforms-could-do-unthinkable-google-year)

**Enea AB (FRA:EED5) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Highlights: Record Prof**
Enea AB (FRA:EED5) reported its highest Q4 profitability in four years, achieving an adjusted EBITDA margin of 40%, reflecting strong financial management. The company saw significant growth in core products, with Deep Packet Inspection rising nearly 20% and Traffic Management increasing over 30%. Enea successfully contained a cyber incident in Q4 without financial loss or customer disruption, underscoring its cybersecurity resilience. The company also signed 10 new customers across EMEA, North America, and Asia Pacific, signaling market expansion. A new strategic focus on market acceleration, vertical expansion, and product evolution was announced to drive future growth. However, net sales declined by 5% in Q4 2025 due to unfavorable foreign exchange impacts, primarily from a 20% appreciation of the Swedish krona against the US dollar over the past year. Operating cash flow before changes in working capital decreased, attributed to volatile financial net positions—SEK41 million positive in Q4 2024 versus SEK6 million negative in Q4 2025—linked to currency fluctuations. Despite large announced contracts, revenue growth was not realized in Q4, indicating challenges in order-to-revenue conversion. The company cited the need to restructure its sales organization into a more customer-centric model as the primary growth constraint, though market dynamics remain positive. CEO Teemu Salmi noted increasing customer interest in Swedish firms due to data sovereignty concerns amid geopolitical tensions, positioning Enea as a trusted alternative to US and Israeli competitors. CFO Ulf Stigberg explained that rising net working capital is due to business mix, particularly longer payment cycles in certain development areas, with ongoing efforts to mitigate this trend.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 30, 2026 03:01 PM
Source:[GuruFocus](https://www.gurufocus.com/news/8568184/enea-ab-fraeed5-q4-2025-earnings-call-highlights-record-profitability-amid-currency-challenges)

**Increased Investor Optimism Lifted Alphabet (GOOGL) in Q4**
Hotchkis & Wiley Global Value Fund reported a 3.80% return in the fourth quarter of 2025, outperforming the MSCI World Value Index's 3.34%. The Fund's year-to-date return was 23.77%, compared to 20.79% for the Index, driven by positive stock selection. The Fund remained overweight in non-US equities, where international stocks outperformed US stocks in 2025, though the valuation gap remained stable. Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) was highlighted as a leading contributor in the Fund's performance. The company’s stock returned 7.33% in one month and gained 65.79% over the past 52 weeks, closing at $338.25 per share on January 29, 2026, with a market capitalization of $4.097 trillion. Strong third-quarter 2025 results, which beat expectations across all segments, boosted investor confidence, particularly in Alphabet’s ability to monetize AI opportunities. Google’s new AI products reportedly captured significant market share from OpenAI’s ChatGPT in consumer chatbot usage. Alphabet achieved its first-ever $100 billion in quarterly revenue in Q3 2025. The company ranked fourth among the 30 most popular stocks among hedge funds, with 243 hedge fund portfolios holding it at the end of Q3 2025—up from 219 in Q2. While the Fund acknowledges Alphabet’s strong position, it believes certain other AI stocks offer greater upside with lower downside risk. The article also references a free report on undervalued AI stocks benefiting from Trump-era tariffs and onshoring trends.
Original language: en-US

**Swatch Starts 2026 with Strong Momentum Despite 2025 Challenges**
Swatch Group reported a 6% decline in group revenue to 6.3 billion Swiss francs in 2025, following a 15% drop in 2024, with the highest-ever revenue of 8.7 billion francs recorded in 2014. The decline was primarily driven by weak demand in China, a strong Swiss franc causing a 308 million franc negative currency impact, and a significant drop in operating profit (EBIT) from 304 million to 135 million francs, and net profit from 250 million to 25 million francs. Despite this, the company reported positive momentum in the second half of 2025, with a 4.7% revenue increase in local currencies, accelerating to 7.2% in the fourth quarter across all price segments. Growth was particularly strong in North America, where revenue rose nearly 20% in constant currency, and also in India, the Middle East, and Poland. China, Hong Kong, and Macau saw recovery in the second half of 2025, returning to growth in local currency. Swatch Group maintained its dividend at 4.50 Swiss francs per share despite the profit decline, signaling confidence in future recovery. The company avoided layoffs and short-time work to remain prepared for growth, using idle staff for R&D. The stock rose nearly 10% to over 175 Swiss francs on January 30, 2026, rebounding from a low of 130 francs in summer 2025. CEO Nick Hayek expressed optimism for 2026, forecasting positive revenue and volume growth and improved profitability, citing renewed global market dynamism.
Original language: de
Publish date: January 30, 2026 12:29 PM
Source:[de.marketscreener.com](https://de.marketscreener.com/boerse-nachrichten/swatch-startet-mit-viel-schwung-ins-jahr-2026-ce7e5bdcdd88f72d)

**Adidas Posts Record 2025 Revenues of €24.8 Billion and Announces €1 Billion Buyback**
Adidas reported record revenues of €24.8 billion for 2025, a 13% increase at constant exchange rates (10% including the Yeezy sales comparison effect from 2024), despite a negative impact from currency fluctuations exceeding €1 billion. The company's performance was driven by strong margins: the gross margin improved to 50.8% in the fourth quarter (up 100 basis points) and reached 51.6% for the full year, up 80 basis points year-on-year, despite headwinds such as higher tariffs and unfavorable exchange rates. Operating profit more than doubled to €1.64 billion in Q4 and reached €2.056 billion for the full year, with an operating margin of 8.3%, up 2.6 percentage points. Growth was double-digit across all markets and channels, supported by a sales mix increasingly focused on full-price selling. In response to the strong results, Adidas's board announced a share buyback program of up to €1 billion starting in February 2026, funded by internal cash flow and aimed at canceling the repurchased shares, signaling confidence to the market. Analysts at Barclays described the Q4 results as a 'slight beat' overall, with revenues and margins exceeding Bloomberg consensus estimates, particularly highlighting the gross margin of 50.8%, about 90 basis points above expectations, attributed to healthy full-price sales that offset currency and tariff impacts. The EBIT margin of 2.8% in Q4 also surpassed the expected 2.4%, and Barclays viewed the buyback as a positive signal of confidence, especially given the stock's performance over the past 12 months.
Original language: it
Publish date: January 30, 2026 11:23 AM
Source:[Milano Finanza](https://www.milanofinanza.it/fashion/adidas-corre-nel-2025-ricavi-record-a-24-8-miliardi-13-e-buyback-da-1-miliardo-202601301157111361)

**Electrolux Q4 2025 Results: Cost Reductions Drive Margin Expansion Despite Regional Challenges**
Electrolux AB (OTC:0MDT) saw its stock rise 22.64% after reporting fourth-quarter 2025 results on January 30, 2026, driven by significant margin expansion and successful cost-reduction initiatives, despite regional challenges. The company reported a net revenue of 35.112 million SEK for Q4 2025, down from 37.968 million SEK in Q4 2024 due to a negative currency impact of -8.9%, though organic growth remained positive at 2.0% (down from 11.5% in the prior year). The operating result improved sharply to 1.517 million SEK (4.3% margin) from 1.052 million SEK (2.8% margin) in Q4 2024. Cash flow from operations after investments reached 5.179 million SEK, nearly double the 2.660 million SEK in Q4 2024, primarily due to working capital optimization, especially inventory management. Regionally, Europe, Middle East, Africa, and Asia (EMEA) delivered 3.6% organic sales growth and a 6.3% operating margin (up from 3.7% in Q4 2024), while Latin America posted 4.1% organic growth and a strong 11.5% margin (up from 8.0%). In contrast, North America faced a 1.7% organic sales decline and an operating loss of 312 million SEK (vs. a 45 million SEK profit in Q4 2024), attributed to higher U.S. tariffs and adverse exchange rates. Electrolux achieved a 4 billion SEK cost reduction in 2025, exceeding its 3.5–4.0 billion SEK target, through product cost optimization, sourcing from lower-cost countries, and global scale advantages. For the full year 2025, organic revenue was 131.282 million SEK (3.9% growth), and operating profit rose to 3.7 billion SEK (2.8% margin) from 1.1 billion SEK (0.8% margin) in 2024. Sustainability goals were advanced, with 45% of the 85% Scope 1 & 2 emissions target and 33% of the 42% Scope 3 target achieved. For 2026, Electrolux forecasts neutral-to-negative market conditions in North America, neutral in Europe and Brazil, with expected positive contributions from volume, price, and product mix. The company aims 3.5–4.0 billion SEK in cost efficiency measures and projects 4 billion SEK in investments, focusing on customer experience and marketing. The CFO, Therese Friberg, highlighted improved liquidity and a debt-to-EBITDA ratio of 3.0x (down from 3.4x in 2024), supporting investment-grade credit standing. Electrolux is restructuring operations to enhance customer focus, clarify roles, and reduce duplication to boost efficiency.
Original language: fr
Publish date: January 30, 2026 09:46 AM
Source:[Investing.com France](https://fr.investing.com/news/company-news/presentation-du-t4-2025-delectrolux--les-reductions-de-couts-stimulent-lexpansion-des-marges-malgre-les-defis-regionaux-93CH-3245235)

**ManpowerGroup Inc (MAN) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Highlights: Naviga**
ManpowerGroup Inc (MAN) reported Q4 2025 earnings with a revenue of $4.7 billion, reflecting a 2% organic constant currency growth, signaling stabilization in revenue trends. The company achieved an adjusted EBITDA margin of 2.1%, driven by improving demand in core markets, particularly in the US and France, where resilience was noted despite political and budget uncertainty. The Manpower brand grew for three consecutive quarters and six quarters in the US, while the diversified multi-brand portfolio continued to perform well. Cost discipline remained a priority, with a 4% constant currency reduction in SG&A expenses, contributing to improved profitability. However, challenges persist: permanent recruitment activity was weaker than expected in Europe, leading to a 30 basis point decline in gross profit margin. Experis declined by 6%, and Talent Solutions by 4%. The company reported a negative earnings per share of $0.29 for the full year, with a 38% constant currency decrease in adjusted EPS. Free cash flow turned negative at $161 million, compared to a $258 million inflow in the prior year. In the Q&A, CEO Jonas Prising emphasized the company’s AI integration through PowerSuite and Sophie AI, aiming to become an AI-enabled global people business, with expected EBITDA margin improvements over the next four years even in a moderate recovery. CFO Jack McGinnis highlighted ongoing progress in France, stability in the US, and strong momentum in Italy. The company expects continued improvement in cash flow and balance sheet management in 2026. Demand for flexible workers remains strong, with both clients and candidates valuing adaptability. AI is seen as more disruptive to white-collar roles, while blue-collar roles are more resilient.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 29, 2026 09:06 PM
Source:[GuruFocus](https://www.gurufocus.com/news/8564324/manpowergroup-inc-man-q4-2025-earnings-call-highlights-navigating-growth-and-challenges-in-a-dynamic-market)

**Weaker Dollar Hits Safilo's 2025 Revenue, but Margins Grew**
Safilo Group reported a 1% decline in preliminary 2025 sales to 983.4 million euros, primarily due to the weakening U.S. dollar against the euro. At constant exchange rates, sales rose 1.8%. In the fourth quarter, sales fell 4.6% to 225 million euros, but increased 0.4% at constant exchange. The company attributed growth to strong performance in Smith’s sports products and the continued expansion of its contemporary and lifestyle portfolios, with key brands including Carrera, David Beckham, Tommy Hilfiger, Marc Jacobs, Boss, Kate Spade, and Carolina Herrera playing a significant role in key markets and distribution channels. North America saw a 7% sales drop in Q4, but a 1.5% increase at constant exchange, driven by wholesale growth and a rebound in Smith’s retail sales, while Blenders remained weak in direct-to-consumer. For 2025, North America was down 2.6% but up 1.8% at constant exchange. Europe edged down 0.1% in Q4 due to lower volumes, the deconsolidation of Lenti (sold in June 2025), and delivery phasing, but revenue grew 2.3% in 2025, with mid-single-digit organic growth in prescription frames. Asia-Pacific sales dropped 17.4% in Q4, or 11.5% at constant exchange, while the rest of the world rose 3.9% at constant exchange. In 2025, Asia-Pacific was up 1.3% and the rest of the world down 10%. Safilo reported improved margins: fourth-quarter gross margin reached 61.9% (up 240 basis points YoY), full-year gross margin was 60.9% (up 120 bps). EBITDA margin in Q4 was 6.7% (up 120 bps), and full-year 2025 EBITDA margin reached 10.8% (up 280 bps), driven by price adjustments in North America, shifting sourcing outside China, and favorable price/mix dynamics. Free cash flow for 2025 was 55 million euros, including 11.9 million euros from the Lenti disposal, and net debt stood at 46 million euros after a 18 million euro share buyback. In December 2025, Safilo acquired 25% of Inspecs Group for approximately 21.7 million pounds. The company stated it remains focused on organic growth and selective acquisitions in 2026 amid ongoing geopolitical and macroeconomic challenges, aiming to strengthen profitability and cash generation to create sustainable long-term value.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 29, 2026 06:17 PM
Source:[WWD](https://wwd.com/business-news/financial/weaker-dollar-impacts-safilo-2025-revenue-margins-grow-1238530963/)

**ALTEN Reports 2025 Annual Revenue: Decline Amid Sectoral Shifts and Signs of Stabilization**
ALTEN reported its 2025 annual revenue results, showing a year-end decline of -1.1% overall, with +4.3% growth in France and -3.7% outside France. At constant perimeter and exchange rates, the decline was -4.5% (-3.6% in France, -4.9% outside France). In the fourth quarter, revenue reached €1,023 million, down -0.35% compared to Q4 2024. Organic decline at constant data was -2.2% (-2.4% in France, -2.2% outside France). The decline was primarily driven by a 16% drop in the Automotive sector, with smaller declines in Telecoms, Other Industries, Electronics, and Public Sector. In contrast, Defense/Safety, Naval, and Energy sectors showed significant growth. The fourth quarter performance exceeded expectations, with Aerospace and Banking/Finance sectors returning to growth. Southern Europe continued strong growth, while Eastern Europe and APAC remained stable. Other regions, except the UK, Benelux, and Nordics, showed gradual improvement. The improved Q4 performance is expected to boost the operating margin to exceed 8.1% of revenue in 2025, as previously estimated on October 23, 2025. The company also completed several acquisitions: a life sciences firm in the US and India (€7.5M, 120 consultants), an embedded software firm in India (€5.2M, 270 consultants), a digital transformation firm in Spain and Latin America (€19M, 300 consultants), and a life sciences firm in France and Belgium (€20.5M, 190 consultants). Activity is gradually stabilizing across sectors, with Aerospace and Banking/Finance already showing growth in Q4 2025. The first half of 2026 will confirm this trend. Annual results for 2025 will be published on Tuesday, February 24, 2026, with a conference on Wednesday, February 25, 2026. ALTEN, a global leader in engineering and IT services, operates in industrial, telecom, and tertiary sectors. The stock is listed on Euronext Paris (ISIN FR0000071946), part of the SBF 120, IT CAC 50, and MIDCAP 100 indices, and eligible for SRD. ALTEN uses alternative performance indicators (non-IFRS) to supplement IFRS metrics, assessing intrinsic performance by excluding currency and consolidation perimeter effects. Constant data growth is calculated by removing the impact of exchange rate changes and consolidation perimeter shifts.

**Ferragamo, Revenues Down 2% in Q4 Amid Weakness in Europe**
Ferragamo reported preliminary consolidated revenues of 282 million euros for the fourth quarter of 2025, a 2% decrease at constant exchange rates compared to the same period in 2024, which aligns closely with the Visible Alpha consensus of 284 million euros. The Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) channel drove performance, accelerating compared to the prior quarter and showing positive trends across all regions, while the wholesale channel experienced a double-digit decline due to a strategic shift toward key customers and a more selective distribution model. Sales in North America grew by 2% at constant exchange rates, while revenues in the EMEA region fell by 10.9% and in Asia-Pacific by 2.3%, though signs of improvement were noted in Korea, China, and Southeast Asia. Ferragamo stated that in 2026 it will focus on consolidating current momentum, fully developing its new brand positioning, and reviewing its retail distribution network, a period during which the company has remained without a CEO for nearly a year.

**Sidetrade: 2025 revenue up 14% at constant exchange rates | Taiwan News | Jan. 21, 2026 00:43**
Sidetrade, a global leader in AI-powered Order-to-Cash solutions, reported a 14% revenue increase at constant currency and 12% on a reported basis for 2025, driven by strong SaaS subscription growth of 20% (18% reported). The company achieved €61.4 million in revenue, with 71% generated from international markets. The United States became the leading region, accounting for 30% of revenue and growing by 25% at constant currency. The acquisition of ezyCollect in Asia-Pacific contributed €2.2 million in revenue and established a new growth engine, representing 13% of Q4 2025 revenue. After a challenging first half of 2025 marked by a 21% decline in bookings, Sidetrade stabilized in H2, with ACV bookings down only 2.8% compared to H2 2024. Full-year ACV bookings totaled €11.04 million, down from €12.73 million in 2024, but remained close to 2023 levels. The company's AI strategy advanced with the deployment of Aimie, its autonomous AI Cash Collection Agent, which entered the pre-launch phase with four multinational clients. The goal is to deploy 15 agents into live production by Q1 2026, enabling the processing of tens of thousands of invoices without human intervention—a world first in the Order-to-Cash industry. Sidetrade renewed its ISO 27001 certification and published SOC Type I and II reports, strengthening trust with enterprise clients. ESG performance was recognized by EthiFinance (Gold medal, 79/100) and EcoVadis (top 15% globally, 'Advanced' category). Olivier Novasque, CEO, stated that the company regained commercial momentum in H2 2025 and expects growth to accelerate in 2026. The next financial announcement is scheduled for March 31, 2026.

**Sidetrade: 2025 revenue up 14% at constant exchange rates**
Sidetrade, a global leader in AI-powered Order-to-Cash applications, reported a 14% revenue increase at constant currency and 12% on a reported basis in 2025, driven by strong SaaS subscription growth of 20% (18% reported). The company achieved an Annual Contract Value (ACV) of €11.04 million in 2025, down 13% year-over-year after a challenging first half marked by a 21% decline, but stabilized in the second half with ACV of €5.16 million, a 2.8% decrease from H2 2024. Revenue growth was fueled by international expansion, with 71% of revenue coming from outside France, and the United States becoming the leading region at 30% of total revenue, growing 25% at constant currency. The acquisition of ezyCollect in Asia-Pacific contributed €2.2 million in revenue and established a new growth engine in the region, which accounted for 13% of Q4 2025 revenue. Sidetrade’s AI strategy advanced with the development of Aimie, the first autonomous AI Cash Collection Agent, which is now in deployment with four multinational clients. The company plans to deploy 15 agents in production by Q1 2026, enabling fully automated processing of tens of thousands of invoices without human intervention—a world first in the Order-to-Cash industry. Sidetrade also renewed its ISO 27001 certification and published SOC Type II reports, enhancing trust with enterprise clients. ESG performance was recognized by EthiFinance (Gold medal, 79/100) and EcoVadis (top 15% globally, 'Advanced' category). The company entered 2026 with a clear strategic vision and strong momentum, with its next financial results to be announced on March 31, 2026.

**Midwich Group Returns to Growth in Second Half of 2025**
Midwich Group plc (LON:MIDW), a global specialist in audiovisual distribution, reported on Tuesday, January 20, 2026, that full-year 2025 revenues are expected to reach approximately £1.3 billion, in line with 2024 levels but showing a return to growth in the second half of the year. Adjusted pre-tax profit is expected to be in line with the Board’s prior expectations of £30 million, with gross margins broadly consistent with the previous year. At constant currency, continuing revenues were slightly below 2024 levels, with organic revenues about 1.5% lower, combining a roughly 3% decline in the first half with a 0.5% increase in the second half. The UK and Ireland segment, accounting for about 40% of group revenues, grew by approximately 7% year-on-year, driven by new supplier launches and increased market share. Revenues in the EMEA region declined by about 5.5% at constant currency, with a 7% drop in the first half and a 4% decline in the second half, affected by weakness in the German corporate market and delayed purchasing decisions in the education sector awaiting federal funding, now approved with projects set to begin in 2026. North American operations saw a revenue decline of approximately 5% at constant currency, impacted by tariff uncertainty and planned transitions to new technical suppliers. The Group generated strong cash flow in 2025, exceeding 100% of adjusted EBITDA—above the long-term target range of 70–80%. Net adjusted debt as of December 31, 2025, was approximately £130 million, slightly lower than at December 2024, representing about 2.3 times adjusted EBITDA. CEO Stephen Fenby noted that despite a challenging year for the sector, the company implemented initiatives to improve future performance, including developing new supplier and customer relationships and pursuing operational efficiencies.

**Q3 2025 Epam Systems Inc Earnings Call Transcript**
EPAM Systems Inc. reported strong third-quarter 2025 financial results, with revenue reaching $1.394 billion, a 19.4% year-over-year increase on a reported basis and 7.1% organic constant currency growth, exceeding expectations. The company achieved its fourth consecutive quarter of positive year-over-year organic constant currency growth, driven by demand in AI-native services, data, and cloud modernization. Five of six industry verticals posted year-over-year growth, with Financial Services (32.7% reported growth), Software and Hi-Tech (19.1% reported growth), and Life Sciences and Healthcare (11.8% reported growth) leading. Geographically, EMEA (11.8% organic constant currency growth) and APAC (14.2% organic constant currency growth) outperformed, while the Americas grew 3.9% organically. EPAM launched its AI Run Transform strategy, a unified AI framework combining AI innovation, business transformation, and AI-native engineering. Key offerings include AI 360, AI Factory, Iron SDLC, and AI adoption frameworks. The company introduced Agentic QA, which demonstrated 10x efficiency over manual testing, reducing manual effort by 50% and testing costs by 30% while covering 90% of standard checks. Client wins included a German telecom provider deploying AI voice agents handling 100,000 weekly calls, a collaboration with Hugo Boss on spatial computing for motorsports, and a joint transformation with NEORIS for a global biopharmaceutical firm. EPAM ended the quarter with 62,350 employees and over 6,100 delivery professionals, achieving a record $295 million in cash flow from operations and $286 million in free cash flow—both all-time highs. The company announced a $1 billion share repurchase program. Full-year 2025 guidance was raised: organic constant currency revenue growth now expected at 4.6% midpoint (up from 4%), non-GAAP diluted EPS projected at $11.36–$11.44, and non-GAAP income from operations at 15%–15.3%. For Q4 2025, revenue is expected at $1.38–$1.395 billion, with 4.4% organic constant currency growth at the midpoint. CEO Balazs Fejes emphasized the company’s focus on AI literacy, with over 90% of employees and 95% of engineers completing AI education. Jason Peterson noted gross margins declined due to higher variable compensation and lower profitability from recent acquisitions, but emphasized strong cash flow and balance sheet strength. The company remains confident in its growth trajectory and profitability improvement, with a focus on disciplined execution and expanding AI-native capabilities.

**Alphabet's Q1 2025 Results Reveal Strong AI Demand and Profitability Across Cloud, Ads, and Consumer Products**
The first-quarter 2025 financial results from Alphabet (Google's parent company) reveal strong evidence of growing global demand for artificial intelligence (AI). Revenue reached $90.2 billion, a 12% year-over-year increase (14% in constant currency), driven by double-digit growth in Google Search, YouTube advertising, subscriptions, and Google Cloud—all fueled by AI innovations. Google Cloud revenue surged 28% to $12.3 billion, with significant growth in AI infrastructure, platform services, and generative AI solutions, indicating rising corporate adoption of AI. Operating profit rose 20% to $30.6 billion, with an operating margin of 34%, demonstrating that AI investments are already enhancing efficiency and profitability. Net profit increased 46% to $34.5 billion, and diluted earnings per share grew 49% to $2.81. The company's CEO, Sundar Pichai, highlighted the launch of Gemini 2.5, described as Alphabet’s most advanced AI model to date, underpinning future innovation. Consumer adoption is also rising, with Alphabet surpassing 270 million paid subscriptions across YouTube and Google One, driven by AI-powered features. On April 23, 2025, the board approved a $70 billion share repurchase program and increased the quarterly dividend by 5% to $0.21 per share, signaling confidence in sustained cash flow and long-term value creation in the AI era. These results reinforce Alphabet’s strategic leadership in both AI infrastructure and consumer-facing applications, with a diversified revenue model that includes cloud, advertising, subscriptions, and strategic investments. The company’s ability to scale AI across multiple business lines while expanding margins underscores its competitive advantage. The broader AI landscape among hyperscalers—Google, Microsoft, and Amazon—shows distinct strategies: Google’s full-stack integration, Microsoft’s enterprise focus via OpenAI and Azure, and Amazon’s AWS dominance—creating a dynamic, overlapping competition. Despite risks like regulatory challenges, slower corporate adoption, and technological obsolescence, Alphabet’s performance indicates these risks are currently manageable. The company’s robust financials, strong cash generation, and sustained double-digit growth across key segments confirm that AI is no longer experimental but a core engine of revenue, efficiency, and shareholder value. The results suggest that AI-driven growth is both scalable and profitable, with hyperscalers consolidating power through massive infrastructure investments, data advantages, and network effects. Investors are increasingly confident, as demonstrated by capital allocation decisions and the company’s continued commitment to AI investment despite short-term margin pressure.

**Paris Pre-Market: CAC 40 on the Brink of Historic High Amid Positive Global Sentiment and Strong Corporate Results**
The Paris stock market is expected to open higher on October 21, 2025, with the CAC 40 poised to surpass its previous historical high of 8,259.19 points set on May 10, 2024, and its annual peak of 8,257.88 points on March 3, 2024. Positive sentiment is driven by U.S. President Donald Trump’s indication that he may reduce tariffs on Chinese goods if Beijing resumes soybean purchases, and by U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s remarks that U.S.-China relations have 'de-escalated,' with a planned meeting scheduled with Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng. Additionally, Kevin Hassett, a White House economic advisor, suggested the U.S. government shutdown could end this week. On Wall Street, major indices rose: the S&P 500 gained 1.07% to 6,735 points, the Nasdaq surged 1.37% to 22,990 points, and the Dow Jones increased 1.12% to 46,706 points. Key corporate updates include Planisware reporting a 5.7% year-on-year revenue increase to €49.6 million in Q3 2025, with constant currency growth at +9% and a 10.3% year-to-date increase. The company reaffirmed its 2025 targets: 10% constant currency revenue growth, ~36% adjusted EBITDA margin, and ~80% cash conversion ratio. Eurofins reported organic revenue growth of 4.2% in Q3 2025, with total revenue of €5.415 billion for the first nine months, up 5.3% year-on-year, and confirmed its 2025 and 2027 financial goals. Getlink saw a 1% constant currency revenue growth in Q3 to €472 million, confirming its 2025 EBITDA target of €780–830 million. OVHcloud achieved €1.0846 billion in revenue in 2025, a 9.3% increase at comparable data, with EBITDA margin rising to 40.4% and net profit of €0.4 million, up from a net loss of €10.3 million in 2024. Interparfums reported a 1.6% increase in Q3 revenue at constant currencies (€261.7 million), with nine-month revenue at €710 million (constant currencies), up 4.4% year-on-year. Edenred and Visa announced a strategic partnership to enhance payment ecosystems, with Edenred’s Q3 revenue growing 8.2% year-on-year to €667 million. BNP Paribas faced a U.S. jury verdict finding it complicit in Sudan-related atrocities due to transactions financing the regime’s military, prompting the bank to announce an appeal. Analysts issued revised ratings: MedioBanca downgraded BNP Paribas to 'neutral' (target: €80.30), Cantor downgraded Ubisoft to 'underperform' (target: €7.10), Bernstein initiated 'outperform' on Exail (target: €150) and Interparfums (target: €37.70), adjusted Forvia to 'market perform' (€10), raised Sartorius Stedim to 'buy' (€236), and reduced Vinci to 'outperform' (€139).

**Guerbet 2025 First‑Half Results: Revenue Down 5.4% at Constant Currency**
Guerbet reported first‑half 2025 consolidated results with revenue of 387.8 M€, a 5.4 % decline at constant currency (TCC) and comparable scope, mainly due to a contraction of French sales following the March 2024 supply‑chain reform. EBITDA margin fell to 12.9 % from 15.4 % a year earlier, while free cash flow remained negative at –8.4 M€, improving from –29.1 M€ in the same period last year. Regional performance varied: EMEA sales were 169.6 M€, down 7.7 % at TCC; outside France sales grew 6.9 % at TCC. In the Americas, sales were flat at –0.3 % at TCC, and Asia saw a 7.3 % drop at TCC. By business segment, diagnostic imaging revenue was 334 M€, down 6.8 % at TCC; MRI sales slipped 1.5 % at TCC; X‑ray sales fell 9.7 % at TCC; interventional imaging grew 4.6 % at TCC, driven by Lipiodol® volumes. The company’s net equity stood at 376 M€, down from 394 M€ a year earlier, and net debt fell to 353.3 M€. Management revised 2025 financial targets to a slight revenue decline of about –1 % at TCC, EBITDA margin of 12‑13 % and a slightly negative free cash flow, citing ongoing French market challenges and pricing pressures. A senior executive quoted: 'Les résultats du premier semestre 2025, sont très en deçà de nos attentes.' The statement underscores the need for rapid corrective action, as noted by Hugues Lecat, chairman, who highlighted the importance of sales recovery, interventional imaging growth, margin discipline and cash generation.
